Title: App first launch shows setup entry point
Preconditions: Fresh install; user logged out
Steps: 1) Install app; 2) Launch app
ExpectedResults: App opens to a clear setup entry point (e.g., Get Started/Start Setup). No crash or hang.
AutomationChecks: App logs/analytics show first-open recorded once; current screen/state indicates setup can start

Title: Login completes and returns to setup flow
Preconditions: Backend reachable; valid test account
Steps: 1) Tap Start Setup; 2) Choose Login; 3) Enter valid credentials; 4) Submit
ExpectedResults: Login succeeds and user lands in Add Device flow without restarting the app.
AutomationChecks: Auth success recorded in app logs; session/token present; app state shows Add Device screen/step

Title: Permission denied path handled (Bluetooth/Location)
Preconditions: OS permission prompts enabled
Steps: 1) Start setup; 2) Deny Bluetooth; 3) Deny Location (if prompted)
ExpectedResults: App blocks setup with clear guidance and a way to open OS Settings. No infinite loading.
AutomationChecks: App logs show permission denied; app shows a blocking state with a stable error reason (permission-required)

Title: Robot powers on and enters setup-ready state
Preconditions: Robot unboxed; battery >=10%
Steps: 1) Press power button per device behavior; 2) Wait up to 30s
ExpectedResults: Robot boots successfully and reaches setup-ready state. No reboot loop.
AutomationChecks: Robot telemetry/log indicates power ON and setup-ready; boot/restart counter does not increase unexpectedly

Title: Dock charging recognized when robot placed on dock
Preconditions: Dock powered; robot ON
Steps: 1) Place robot on dock; 2) Wait up to 10s
ExpectedResults: Robot reports docked + charging.
AutomationChecks: Robot telemetry shows docked status and charging status; battery level trend increases over time

Title: BLE discovery lists correct model/serial
Preconditions: Phone Bluetooth ON; permissions granted; robot READY
Steps: 1) Tap Add Device; 2) Scan (<=20s); 3) Select robot
ExpectedResults: Robot appears in discovery once with correct identity (model + serial identifier). Selecting it starts pairing.
AutomationChecks: App discovery results contain robot identifier matching device label/serial; pairing step begins (logged or state-based)

Title: Pairing succeeds and local session established
Preconditions: Robot discoverable
Steps: 1) Select robot; 2) Confirm pairing if prompted; 3) Wait <=30s
ExpectedResults: Pairing completes and app can read robot status.
AutomationChecks: App logs show pairing success; app can query at least one robot status signal (proof of session)

Title: Wi-Fi provisioning success (2.4GHz)
Preconditions: 2.4GHz SSID visible; correct password; DHCP + internet available
Steps: 1) Select SSID; 2) Enter password; 3) Submit; 4) Wait <=90s
ExpectedResults: Robot connects to Wi-Fi, gets an IP, and setup proceeds.
AutomationChecks: Robot connectivity state shows Wi-Fi connected + IP assigned; robot reports internet reachable (or cloud ping succeeds); app advances to next setup step

Title: Wrong Wi-Fi password shows explicit error and retry
Preconditions: SSID visible
Steps: 1) Select SSID; 2) Enter wrong password; 3) Submit; 4) Wait <=60s
ExpectedResults: Provisioning fails with a clear authentication error and user can retry without re-pairing.
AutomationChecks: App shows stable error reason (auth failure) and retry option; robot does not remain in 'connected' state

Title: 5GHz-only network rejected with guidance
Preconditions: Only 5GHz available OR robot supports 2.4GHz only
Steps: 1) Attempt to provision using a 5GHz-only SSID
ExpectedResults: App blocks or fails fast with clear guidance (2.4GHz required).
AutomationChecks: App provides stable failure reason (unsupported band); provisioning does not proceed into a long spinner

Title: Hidden SSID manual entry supported or explicitly rejected
Preconditions: Hidden SSID; user knows SSID + password
Steps: 1) Choose manual/hidden network entry; 2) Enter SSID + password; 3) Submit; 4) Wait <=90s
ExpectedResults: Robot either connects successfully OR app shows an explicit unsupported path (no silent fail).
AutomationChecks: Either robot shows connected state OR app shows a stable failure reason tied to hidden SSID handling

Title: Firmware update completes and version increments
Preconditions: Robot online; update available; battery sufficient or docked
Steps: 1) Start firmware update; 2) Wait for completion/reboot; 3) Reconnect
ExpectedResults: Update completes successfully and robot reports the new firmware version.
AutomationChecks: Robot update status transitions to completed; firmware version reported after reboot matches target version; app resumes setup

Title: Firmware update blocked on low battery
Preconditions: Battery low; robot not docked; update available
Steps: 1) Attempt firmware update
ExpectedResults: App blocks update and prompts user to dock/charge before continuing.
AutomationChecks: App shows stable failure reason (low battery); update does not start until charging is detected

Title: Edge: network drop during account binding doesnâ€™t create ghost device
Preconditions: Provisioning OK locally; simulate internet drop during binding
Steps: 1) Provision Wi-Fi; 2) Drop internet right after robot joins Wi-Fi; 3) Let binding fail/timeout; 4) Restore internet; 5) Retry
ExpectedResults: Retry completes binding and user ends up with a single usable device in the account.
AutomationChecks: Backend shows only one device record tied to the account; binding status reaches completed after retry; app proceeds without factory reset

Title: App killed mid-provisioning resumes to correct step
Preconditions: Provisioning screen open
Steps: 1) Start Wi-Fi provisioning; 2) Force close app; 3) Relaunch; 4) Return to setup flow
ExpectedResults: Setup resumes at the correct step and keeps the same device context.
AutomationChecks: App restores setup session state (device selected + current step); user is not forced to restart from pairing unless session expired

Title: Edge: robot reboot during provisioning/update recovers
Preconditions: Auto-update enabled or reboot injected mid-provisioning
Steps: 1) Start provisioning; 2) Trigger robot reboot mid-step; 3) Observe recovery; 4) Continue setup
ExpectedResults: System recovers to a known state and setup can continue without manual reset.
AutomationChecks: Robot returns to a consistent setup mode (resume or restart provisioning); update (if triggered) completes; no duplicate device record appears

Title: Timezone/region saved and reflected in timestamps
Preconditions: Robot online
Steps: 1) Set region; 2) Set language; 3) Set timezone; 4) Save
ExpectedResults: Settings persist and are used in run history timestamps.
AutomationChecks: Robot/app config reflects region/language/timezone after save; run timestamps align with selected timezone

Title: Edge: two phones concurrent setup enforces setup lock
Preconditions: Phone A + Phone B same account; robot READY
Steps: 1) Start setup on Phone A; 2) Attempt setup on Phone B for same robot
ExpectedResults: Second setup attempt is blocked until the first completes/cancels/times out.
AutomationChecks: Phone B receives a stable 'setup in progress/locked' error; only one active setup session exists at a time

Title: Edge: captive portal detected (connected but no internet)
Preconditions: SSID uses captive portal; DHCP OK; internet blocked
Steps: 1) Provision Wi-Fi; 2) Continue setup
ExpectedResults: Robot may connect to Wi-Fi locally but app detects no internet and blocks cloud-dependent steps with guidance.
AutomationChecks: Robot reports no-internet (or cloud connectivity check fails); app shows stable failure reason and suggests switching networks

Title: First cleaning run completes with map + run summary
Preconditions: Robot online; firmware current; bin installed; map not created yet
Steps: 1) Start first cleaning run; 2) Verify robot starts cleaning; 3) Let it complete or stop after a reasonable time; 4) Confirm end state
ExpectedResults: Cleaning run completes, map is created/saved, and run summary is recorded.
AutomationChecks: Robot status shows cleaning start then completion; map creation state indicates saved/ready; run summary exists in app/backend history
